error_context: All pytest matrix runs failed during the 'Test with pytest' step. The ubuntu-latest runs for python 3.14.0-beta.3 and 3.13 failed with a parsing/unexpected-token error: "Expected a ']' but saw '}'". The python 3.10 run failed with a string-literal parsing error: "Line terminator characters must be escaped inside string literals', 'U+000A'". These messages indicate syntax/parsing errors encountered by pytest (or the Python parser used by pytest) while loading tests or source files, causing pytest to abort before completing the test suite. The failures are all from the same workflow run of the 'pytest' job and occurred when executing the 'Test with pytest' run block that invokes pytest.

error_types.evidence: Two runs reported: "Expected a ']' but saw '}'" (pytest (3.14.0-beta.3) and pytest (3.13)). This indicates a mismatched bracket or similar token parsing error.

error_types.subcategory: Unescaped line terminator in string literal
error_types.evidence: One run reported: "Line terminator characters must be escaped inside string literals', 'U+000A'" (pytest (3.10)), indicating an unescaped newline inside a string literal caused parsing to fail.

failed_job.command:
# We test without optional dependencies first. This includes:
# - without pytz
# - without jobqueue
# - without ratelimiter
# - without webhooks
# - without arbitrary callback data
# - without socks support
# - without http2 support
TO_TEST="test_no_passport.py or test_datetime.py or test_defaults.py or test_jobqueue.py or test_applicationbuilder.py or test_ratelimiter.py or test_updater.py or test_callbackdatacache.py or test_request.py"
pytest -v --cov -k "${TO_TEST}" --junit-xml=.test_report_no_optionals_junit.xml
opt_dep_status=$?

# Test the rest
export TEST_WITH_OPT_DEPS='true'
pip install .[all]
# `-n auto --dist worksteal` uses pytest-xdist to run tests on multiple CPU
# workers. Increasing number of workers has little effect on test duration, but it seems
# to increase flakyness.
pytest -v --cov --cov-append -n auto --dist worksteal --junit-xml=.test_report_optionals_junit.xml
main_status=$?
# exit with non-zero status if any of the two pytest runs failed
exit $(( ${opt_dep_status} || ${main_status} ))
